folder: Bay Street & Grant Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
360 Bay Street, at the N.W. corner of Grant Street, showing the Planters' Hotel. It was built in 1820 and was a gathering place for Southern plantere. In 1859 it was the photographic studio of H. Hoyer, and was later taken over by J. Loeffler, well known
Staten Island photographer.
View 11 Summer, 1924
Views 2, 3: September 9, 1937
P. L. Sperr

folder: Bay Street & Grant Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
378, 372 and 360 Bay Street, west side, at Grant Street. No. 360 is at the N. W. corner of Grant Street and is the old Planters' Hotel, built in 1820. No. 378 was the home of G. Seeber (1874 to 1907), and No. 372 belonged to Wandell (1874 and 1898)
and to T. H. Gogal (1907).
May 27, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
An exclusive view of Nos. 372 and 360. No. 372 is at
the S. W. corner of Grant Street.
May 27, 1931
P. L. Sperr

folder: Bay Street & Grant Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
Bay Street, west side, south from Grant (rightl to Clinton Streets. The vtew is from an empty lot on the
east side of Bay Street.
May 27, 1931
P. L. Sperr
